> Thanks again for the answers to my questions.

No problem; we appreciate =
and encourage more 2.0 feedback. :)

> Thanks for your detailed answers. If=
 I seem reluctant to leave behind
> the order.xml format, it is not for a p=
articular love of xml or the
> order.xml format. It is simply that we have =
infrastructure deployed
> that makes use of order.xml.

Would a conversion =
tool of 1.x order.xml/overrides -> sheets help  
with your transition?

> A=
dditionally, I have been developing an
> HTTP interface for Heritrix which =
extends the order.xml format to
> allow creating jobs, retrieving data, etc=
. from a running Heritrix
> instance using HTTP (rather than JMX), and I am=
 going to have to
> determine how to rework this to work with the new setti=
ngs format. I
> had not realized until a few days ago that the new settings=
 had
> progressed so far and that order.xml files were to be left behind.

=
Nirvana for us would be an HTTPOpenMbeanJMXConnector -- you'd specify  
ope=
ration parameters/attribute names in a POST-like payload, and  
you'd get b=
ack XML or YAML or JSON with the results of the operation/ 
attribute value=
.

There are projects out there that do this for "standard" MBeans, but  
n=
ot for OpenMBeans -- anything more complicated than a primitive  
value or =
String gets serialized and Base64 encoded, which is only  
useful if you ha=
ve Java code as the client.

But if an OpenMBeans-aware HTTP connector exis=
ted, we would gladly  
integrate it into the engine. Then people could more=
 easily control  
Heritrix using widely available scripting languages like =
perl.

I should mention that, unlike in 1.x, in 2.x anything that can happe=
n  
in the Web UI can also happen over JMX. The Web UI now uses JMX  
exclu=
sively to communicate with Heritrix.

> Since the order of the lines matter=
s for maps, can you do something to
> append to a list? For instance:
>
> r=
oot:controller:processors:HTTP:accept-headers:_=3Dstring, audio/*;  
> q=3D=
0.2, audio/basic
>
> Just a though, since I generally dislike hard coding t=
he index of a
> list.

I really like this idea; would you mind filing a Fea=
ture Enhancement  
in JIRA?

> I had assumed (correctly, I think) that in t=
he past the names of
> certain objects determined their primary-ness (for i=
nstance, the
> object named =91scope=92 was the scope used for the crawl). =
This seems to
> make more sense than enforcing a particular name for the se=
ttings.

The new method is good and bad. It doesn't make a lot of sense to =
 
have to manually specify "primary" for a thing like CrawlController  
-- =
it's difficult to imagine needing more than one of those.

On the other han=
d, it's easy to imagine needing more than BDB  
environment. Assuming you h=
ad three separate disk drives, then you  
could specify one BDB environment=
 for the settings system, one for  
the Frontier and one for the crawl hist=
ory database. I think it made  
more sense to make all the modules behave t=
he same (if you really  
want a second CrawlController -- perhaps some stra=
nge, customized  
subclass? -- the settings system won't stop you).

-Paul
